abandonment","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0315983/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lipwer"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"can't believe it didn't win academy awards","reviewBody":"This is a really good movie. The cast is wonderful. If this is a first movie I will line up for any future films from the director. Roger Deakons is superb as the DP. I only wonder how a first time director got him. The story is gripping and the cinematography is haunting. As I watched it I just kept wondering how it would end. I never saw the real ending coming. I loved all the characters and even wanted more. The juxtaposition of the two story lines was fascinating. I wanted to hate someone but couldn't. The only bad guy is the cop. Everyone makes mistakes but his just seem so brutal. I had never noticed Jennifer Connelly before but I will make an effort to see any films with her in the future. As I watched this film I asked if I should make some changes in my own life so that this sort of thing doesn't happen to me. If you read the synopsis you will miss what this movie is really about. Watch it. You will be better for it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":66104,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT2H6M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Crveni mesec
programme.desc: Ljubavna, ali i snažna istorijska priča koja se tiče svih nas, smeštena je u period od avgusta 1913, nakon pobede Srbije u Balkanskim ratovima kada je povratila deo teoritorije, do kraja 1915. godine,... Ljubavna, ali i snažna istorijska priča koja se tiče svih nas, smeštena je u period od avgusta 1913, nakon pobede Srbije u Balkanskim ratovima kada je povratila deo teoritorije, do kraja 1915. godine, kada je austrougarska vojska okupirala Beograd. Glavni junak, mladi srpski oficir, vraća se sa ratišta u rodnu kuću. Svadba mu je, tradicionalno, već zakazana, ali zaplet priče počinje kada ćerka austrougarskog poslanika, koju igra Ivana Dudić, "baci oko" na njega. Nedopustivo za to vreme, koketna mlada dama, ne krije svoja osećanja. Rasplet njihove ljubavne drame (koja je plod mašte autora) odvija se u realnom istorijskom periodu pred Veliki rat, pa se u scenariju pojavljuje još dvadesetak glavnih likova, uglavnom stvarnih istorijskih ličnosti. Biće tu dramatičnih događanja, špijunskih intriga, diplomatskih nadmudrivanja, političkih spletki i prevara...

programme.desc: Directed by Eric Zaragoza. With Scott Adkins, Aaron McCusker, Michelle Lehane, Vahidin Prelic. The International Space Station is now a prison - the ultimate black site. No one's getting out. And no one knows it's there. But when the imprisoned terrorists take over the Station and turn it into a missile aimed at Moscow, only a shuttle pilot and a rookie doctor can stop them. Their task is complicated by a rogue CIA agent (Scott Adkins) who has his own plans for the station and the ...

After their plane crashes in Alaska, six oil workers are led by a skilled huntsman to survival, but a pack of merciless wolves haunts their every step." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1601913/","name":"The Grey","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDY4MTQwMzc1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzcwNTM5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000553/","name":"Liam Neeson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000551/","name":"Dermot Mulroney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342029/","name":"Frank Grillo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0138620/","name":"Joe Carnahan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0342335/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0119195/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0192696/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0138620/","name":"Joe Carnahan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2259451/","name":"Ian Mackenzie Jeffers"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2672533017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3ODEwMDM1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzg4NzgxNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3ODEwMDM1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzg4NzgxNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Alaska, an oil drilling team struggle to survive after a plane crash strands them in the wild. Hunting the humans are a pack of wolves who see them as intruders."},"datePublished":"2012-01-27","description":"After their plane crashes in Alaska, six oil workers are led by a skilled huntsman to survival, but a pack of merciless wolves haunts their every step.","keywords":"snow,survival,wolf,alcohol,howling","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1601913/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jcoria"},"dateCreated":"2018-07-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Much Deeper than a survival film","reviewBody":"Just a few comments about this Jack Londonesque movie. Beyond the surface this movie harpoons the great competitions of man versus man, man versus nature, man versus God and man versus himself. What the director was able to accomplish in this raw film is an inspiration. A man evolving from suicidal tendencies, a man who protected life but initially cares little of his own, revealed his true flesh of wanting to live. The ethereal remembrances provided a cloudy peek into his pain. The parallels of the pack of wolves and the pack of men within the indifferent universe. Oh my fellow watchers this visceral movie gives us hope, purpose and the untethered pang of raw survival. To rage against the cold, while the hungry wolves that lurk in our souls attempt to devour us. Those that rate this movie poorly lack the honed taste of organic storytelling. Shakespeare throughout this movie. Enter the Gray with fortitude and alacrity and your poem will write itself. Well done.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":243464,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

Schamus"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hulk","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1139409177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTQyNGIxMzctM2NkYy00ZWY4LWIwN2MtYzJmNDQ3MDJiNmRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTQyNGIxMzctM2NkYy00ZWY4LWIwN2MtYzJmNDQ3MDJiNmRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"2003-06-20","description":"Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry.","keywords":"radiation,monster,scientist,general,technology","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Pi72"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting and different superhero adaptation","reviewBody":"Hulk is an excellent action/drama and science-fiction film based on the classic superhero (or antihero) The Incredible Hulk. Following the trend on the last years about recycling comic superheroes, Hulk's turn became a very interesting alternative to other formulas used in several of these adaptations.

Knowing that many people consider this movie as dull and boring, please let me state that it's far from being dull. After the critics towards Spiderman just scratching the surface of character development, and where other movies simply failed miserably (e.g. Daredevil), we should be grateful that we can finally see some depth in the main character as we're used in the good comics.

Ang Lee's direction shows his usual way of telling stories, in a sensitive and personal way. Instead of letting the movie drown in its limitless action possibilities, he conducted the story through a sensible path. The editing work, which remarkably resembles comic frames in many scenes, and contains some awesome transitions, is simply wonderful.

And all this not forgetting Hulk's main point: a green, angry mass of power and destruction. The movie has some of the best action scenes I've seen lately, which makes me wonder what is expecting some people who blame this movie for its lack of massive fights against entire armies. My opinion is that the action scenes of Hulk are perfectly balanced; more than showing Hulk's sheer strength but never going completely overboard. And also showing some of Hulk's main weaknesses, keeping the character real and not entering the area of fantasy.

One side of this movie that people also seems to throw tantrums about, is the refurbishing of Hulk's origins. The story of Bruce Banner's transformation has been updated with including today's technology, and making it in my humble opinion much more interesting and 'believable' than the original. Not being a huge fan of Hulk's comics, I didn't feel personally attached to the original story, so I actually liked it more. But I can understand that the purists or the die-hard fans will be disappointed by these changes.

Along with Hulk's origins, the plot includes good science-fiction elements. Don't misunderstand me; the stuff is in general barely believable. A scientist conducting advanced genetic experiments in 1965 (all by himself!) is not a good start... But in the end, it doesn't matter. This superhero adaptation is as good science-fiction as other excellent adaptations like X-Men (including its sequel X2), where others will just remain as good or bad action films with just some sci-fi scattered around. Where others lost their opportunity, Hulk didn't.

What other things are good in this movie? Well, the main actors all do a good work, specially Jennifer Conelly and Nick Nolte. The special effects are great, and while there are entire scenes made just of CGI, they're still not the strong point of the movie. The plot and dialogues aren't just bridges between computer generated action scenes, which I'm thankful for. Furthermore, the plot is also rich in references to the comic, Hulk's enemies and other subtle things. The movie is full of small details (has anyone noticed the frog over the hat in the final scene?) which reward you when watching it a second or third time.

The main down of the movie might be that followers aren't used to see Hulk in this way, a deep and sensitive character, and probably expected more action and enemy-smashing and less deep dialogues running after child traumas... Which could explain its relatively low rating and some bad critics. Maybe I just connected very well with this movie and that's why I put it so well, but I can also see that the elements of this film, taken independently, also have their merits and all together form a solid production. In my opinion, of all the comic superhero adaptations, Hulk is the most interesting and best quality one which I've watched to date. I just wish people would concentrate more on enjoying this different view of a superhero's life. But oh well, each one has different tastes.

And one final note. The soundtrack is absolutely wonderful!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":254922,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

Schamus"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hulk","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1139409177","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTQyNGIxMzctM2NkYy00ZWY4LWIwN2MtYzJmNDQ3MDJiNmRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTQyNGIxMzctM2NkYy00ZWY4LWIwN2MtYzJmNDQ3MDJiNmRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment","datePublished":"2003-06-20","description":"Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry.","keywords":"radiation,monster,scientist,general,technology","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286716/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Pi72","dateCreated":"2005-06-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting and different superhero adaptation","reviewBody":"Hulk is an excellent action/drama and science-fiction film based on the classic superhero (or antihero) The Incredible Hulk. Following the trend on the last years about recycling comic superheroes, Hulk's turn became a very interesting alternative to other formulas used in several of these adaptations.

Knowing that many people consider this movie as dull and boring, please let me state that it's far from being dull. After the critics towards Spiderman just scratching the surface of character development, and where other movies simply failed miserably (e.g. Daredevil), we should be grateful that we can finally see some depth in the main character as we're used in the good comics.

Ang Lee's direction shows his usual way of telling stories, in a sensitive and personal way. Instead of letting the movie drown in its limitless action possibilities, he conducted the story through a sensible path. The editing work, which remarkably resembles comic frames in many scenes, and contains some awesome transitions, is simply wonderful.

And all this not forgetting Hulk's main point: a green, angry mass of power and destruction. The movie has some of the best action scenes I've seen lately, which makes me wonder what is expecting some people who blame this movie for its lack of massive fights against entire armies. My opinion is that the action scenes of Hulk are perfectly balanced; more than showing Hulk's sheer strength but never going completely overboard. And also showing some of Hulk's main weaknesses, keeping the character real and not entering the area of fantasy.

One side of this movie that people also seems to throw tantrums about, is the refurbishing of Hulk's origins. The story of Bruce Banner's transformation has been updated with including today's technology, and making it in my humble opinion much more interesting and 'believable' than the original. Not being a huge fan of Hulk's comics, I didn't feel personally attached to the original story, so I actually liked it more. But I can understand that the purists or the die-hard fans will be disappointed by these changes.

Along with Hulk's origins, the plot includes good science-fiction elements. Don't misunderstand me; the stuff is in general barely believable. A scientist conducting advanced genetic experiments in 1965 (all by himself!) is not a good start... But in the end, it doesn't matter. This superhero adaptation is as good science-fiction as other excellent adaptations like X-Men (including its sequel X2), where others will just remain as good or bad action films with just some sci-fi scattered around. Where others lost their opportunity, Hulk didn't.

What other things are good in this movie? Well, the main actors all do a good work, specially Jennifer Conelly and Nick Nolte. The special effects are great, and while there are entire scenes made just of CGI, they're still not the strong point of the movie. The plot and dialogues aren't just bridges between computer generated action scenes, which I'm thankful for. Furthermore, the plot is also rich in references to the comic, Hulk's enemies and other subtle things. The movie is full of small details (has anyone noticed the frog over the hat in the final scene?) which reward you when watching it a second or third time.

The main down of the movie might be that followers aren't used to see Hulk in this way, a deep and sensitive character, and probably expected more action and enemy-smashing and less deep dialogues running after child traumas... Which could explain its relatively low rating and some bad critics. Maybe I just connected very well with this movie and that's why I put it so well, but I can also see that the elements of this film, taken independently, also have their merits and all together form a solid production. In my opinion, of all the comic superhero adaptations, Hulk is the most interesting and best quality one which I've watched to date. I just wish people would concentrate more on enjoying this different view of a superhero's life. But oh well, each one has different tastes.

And one final note. The soundtrack is absolutely wonderful!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":254922,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6,"duration":"PT2H18M"</script><metacontent="

Set in a medieval village that is haunted by a werewolf, a young girl falls for an orphaned woodcutter, much to her family's displeasure." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1486185/","name":"Red Riding Hood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NjYyMzQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE5Mjc3NA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Fantasy","Horror","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1086543/","name":"Amanda Seyfried"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001305/","name":"Lukas Haas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000198/","name":"Gary Oldman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0362566/","name":"Catherine Hardwicke"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0088354/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424901/","name":"David Leslie Johnson-McGoldrick"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Red Riding Hood: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2514656025","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyMDA3NzY4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDcxNTMyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyMDA3NzY4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDcxNTMyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a twist on the fairy tale, Valerie, a young woman torn between two men. plans on escaping her village with her true love. But when her sister is killed by a werewolf in the dark forest near her home, Valerie soon realizes that she has a special connection to the beast."},"datePublished":"2011-03-11","description":"Set in a medieval village that is haunted by a werewolf, a young girl falls for an orphaned woodcutter, much to her family's displeasure.","keywords":"younger version of character,dumping a dead body in a lake,character name as title,little red riding hood character,silver sword","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1486185/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Meven_Stoffat"},"dateCreated":"2011-03-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"The better to bore you with, my dear.","reviewBody":"Has it become increasingly difficult to write an ending? Have writers suddenly forgotten that the climax is the high point of a story? Or is Hollywood getting lazy? Red Riding Hood is probably the most frustrating and unsatisfying movie I've been to, and the above reason is just one of many. While it certainly isn't bad, I haven't finished feeling so let down since Haneke's "The White Ribbon".

Of course, Hardwicke is a director who is willing take big risks. She did so with Twilight, which was a huge smash with teens everywhere. And she does have a good eye for a shot, and several scenes here show. If had to recommend the movie for one thing alone, it would be for the visuals. The look of the film has a gorgeous, lush and colourful palette that made this film worth seeing on the big screen.

The film's biggest problem aside from being anti-climatic is that the plot is just... a mangled mess. It reads like a really bad fanfiction. If you thought Tim Burton's Alice In Wonderland was bad... .wait till you get a load of this movie. We have several plot points that come in and suddenly are left do die, one of which includes Father Solomon played by Gary Oldman, who is made to be a crazy bastard type character, and we don't see anything to prove it. To top it all off, it's rife with clichés, like the obligatory love triangle, the whodunit, damned protagonist.

The actors are a mixed bag. Seyfried does a good job here and has plenty of emotion in her performance. She has plenty of cheesy lines but she does a good job for what she has to work with. Gary Oldman was also great, but that was expected as he always shines with every performance. On the downside, Shiloh Fernandez gives one of the worst performances ever here. He spends the whole movie looking like he wants to punch someone and reads his lines like he's reading them off a paper. And Virginia Madsen just awful here as well, and is over-acting Billy Burke In short Red Riding Hood is a film that has plenty of promise, but sadly doesn't live up to it. It isn't a bad film by any means, but you are most likely to leave disappointed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":109074,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

But when her sister is killed by a werewolf in the dark forest near her home, Valerie soon realizes that she has a special connection to the beast.","datePublished":"2011-03-11","description":"Set in a medieval village that is haunted by a werewolf, a young girl falls for an orphaned woodcutter, much to her family's displeasure.","keywords":"younger version of character,dumping a dead body in a lake,character name as title,little red riding hood character,silver sword","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1486185/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Meven_Stoffat","dateCreated":"2011-03-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"The better to bore you with, my dear.","reviewBody":"Has it become increasingly difficult to write an ending? Have writers suddenly forgotten that the climax is the high point of a story? Or is Hollywood getting lazy? Red Riding Hood is probably the most frustrating and unsatisfying movie I've been to, and the above reason is just one of many. While it certainly isn't bad, I haven't finished feeling so let down since Haneke's "The White Ribbon".

Of course, Hardwicke is a director who is willing take big risks. She did so with Twilight, which was a huge smash with teens everywhere. And she does have a good eye for a shot, and several scenes here show. If had to recommend the movie for one thing alone, it would be for the visuals. The look of the film has a gorgeous, lush and colourful palette that made this film worth seeing on the big screen.

The film's biggest problem aside from being anti-climatic is that the plot is just... a mangled mess. It reads like a really bad fanfiction. If you thought Tim Burton's Alice In Wonderland was bad... .wait till you get a load of this movie. We have several plot points that come in and suddenly are left do die, one of which includes Father Solomon played by Gary Oldman, who is made to be a crazy bastard type character, and we don't see anything to prove it. To top it all off, it's rife with clichés, like the obligatory love triangle, the whodunit, damned protagonist.

The actors are a mixed bag. Seyfried does a good job here and has plenty of emotion in her performance. She has plenty of cheesy lines but she does a good job for what she has to work with. Gary Oldman was also great, but that was expected as he always shines with every performance. On the downside, Shiloh Fernandez gives one of the worst performances ever here. He spends the whole movie looking like he wants to punch someone and reads his lines like he's reading them off a paper. And Virginia Madsen just awful here as well, and is over-acting Billy Burke In short Red Riding Hood is a film that has plenty of promise, but sadly doesn't live up to it. It isn't a bad film by any means, but you are most likely to leave disappointed.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":109074,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent="

The look of the film has a gorgeous, lush and colourful palette that made this film worth seeing on the big screen.

The film's biggest problem aside from being anti-climatic is that the plot is just... a mangled mess. It reads like a really bad fanfiction. If you thought Tim Burton's Alice In Wonderland was bad... .wait till you get a load of this movie. We have several plot points that come in and suddenly are left do die, one of which includes Father Solomon played by Gary Oldman, who is made to be a crazy bastard type character, and we don't see anything to prove it. To top it all off, it's rife with clichés, like the obligatory love triangle, the whodunit, damned protagonist.

The actors are a mixed bag. Seyfried does a good job here and has plenty of emotion in her performance. She has plenty of cheesy lines but she does a good job for what she has to work with. Gary Oldman was also great, but that was expected as he always shines with every performance. On the downside, Shiloh Fernandez gives one of the worst performances ever here. He spends the whole movie looking like he wants to punch someone and reads his lines like he's reading them off a paper. And Virginia Madsen just awful here as well, and is over-acting Billy Burke In short Red Riding Hood is a film that has plenty of promise, but sadly doesn't live up to it. It isn't a bad film by any means, but you are most likely to leave disappointed.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":109074,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent="

Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"2003-06-20","description":"Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry.","keywords":"radiation,monster,scientist,general,technology","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Pi72"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting and different superhero adaptation","reviewBody":"Hulk is an excellent action/drama and science-fiction film based on the classic superhero (or antihero) The Incredible Hulk. Following the trend on the last years about recycling comic superheroes, Hulk's turn became a very interesting alternative to other formulas used in several of these adaptations.

Knowing that many people consider this movie as dull and boring, please let me state that it's far from being dull. After the critics towards Spiderman just scratching the surface of character development, and where other movies simply failed miserably (e.g. Daredevil), we should be grateful that we can finally see some depth in the main character as we're used in the good comics.

Ang Lee's direction shows his usual way of telling stories, in a sensitive and personal way. Instead of letting the movie drown in its limitless action possibilities, he conducted the story through a sensible path. The editing work, which remarkably resembles comic frames in many scenes, and contains some awesome transitions, is simply wonderful.

And all this not forgetting Hulk's main point: a green, angry mass of power and destruction. The movie has some of the best action scenes I've seen lately, which makes me wonder what is expecting some people who blame this movie for its lack of massive fights against entire armies. My opinion is that the action scenes of Hulk are perfectly balanced; more than showing Hulk's sheer strength but never going completely overboard. And also showing some of Hulk's main weaknesses, keeping the character real and not entering the area of fantasy.

One side of this movie that people also seems to throw tantrums about, is the refurbishing of Hulk's origins. The story of Bruce Banner's transformation has been updated with including today's technology, and making it in my humble opinion much more interesting and 'believable' than the original. Not being a huge fan of Hulk's comics, I didn't feel personally attached to the original story, so I actually liked it more. But I can understand that the purists or the die-hard fans will be disappointed by these changes.

Along with Hulk's origins, the plot includes good science-fiction elements. Don't misunderstand me; the stuff is in general barely believable. A scientist conducting advanced genetic experiments in 1965 (all by himself!) is not a good start... But in the end, it doesn't matter. This superhero adaptation is as good science-fiction as other excellent adaptations like X-Men (including its sequel X2), where others will just remain as good or bad action films with just some sci-fi scattered around. Where others lost their opportunity, Hulk didn't.

What other things are good in this movie? Well, the main actors all do a good work, specially Jennifer Conelly and Nick Nolte. The special effects are great, and while there are entire scenes made just of CGI, they're still not the strong point of the movie. The plot and dialogues aren't just bridges between computer generated action scenes, which I'm thankful for. Furthermore, the plot is also rich in references to the comic, Hulk's enemies and other subtle things. The movie is full of small details (has anyone noticed the frog over the hat in the final scene?) which reward you when watching it a second or third time.

The main down of the movie might be that followers aren't used to see Hulk in this way, a deep and sensitive character, and probably expected more action and enemy-smashing and less deep dialogues running after child traumas... Which could explain its relatively low rating and some bad critics. Maybe I just connected very well with this movie and that's why I put it so well, but I can also see that the elements of this film, taken independently, also have their merits and all together form a solid production. In my opinion, of all the comic superhero adaptations, Hulk is the most interesting and best quality one which I've watched to date. I just wish people would concentrate more on enjoying this different view of a superhero's life. But oh well, each one has different tastes.

And one final note. The soundtrack is absolutely wonderful!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":254922,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

Slightly it's revealed that they're not the same as they were." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0138304/","name":"The Astronaut's Wife","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNGI2NzUtYzgwNy00NmIyLTgwNjMtZGMzYjhlYjY1MThkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000234/","name":"Charlize Theron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000136/","name":"Johnny Depp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0608012/","name":"Joe Morton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712444/","name":"Rand Ravich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0034487/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712444/","name":"Rand Ravich"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Astronaut's Wife","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2357788953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjA1NDQxODMtY2QzMi00ODYwLTgxZWMtM2UyMjcwZjlmMDk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjA1NDQxODMtY2QzMi00ODYwLTgxZWMtM2UyMjcwZjlmMDk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema"},"datePublished":"1999-08-27","description":"After an explosion in space and subsequent two-minute radio-out period, two astronauts return home to their wives. Slightly it's revealed that they're not the same as they were.","keywords":"astronaut,mission,electrocuted in bathtub,sister,pilot","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0138304/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Movie-12"},"dateCreated":"2000-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Visually enticing and well acted, but poorly executes good ideas. ** out of ****.","reviewBody":"THE ASTRONAUT'S WIFE / (1999) **

Johnny Depp plays a NASA astronaut named Spencer Armacost who, while on a space mission, losses contact with Earth for two minutes. He and his colleague, Alex Streck (Nick Cassavetes), return home to their spouses, Jillian Armacost (Charlize Theron) and Natalie Streck (Donna Murphy). Bizarre episodes begin to occur with Alex, leaving Jillian suspicious of her husband's condition. As her husband's strange behavior increases, Jillian begins to question what really happened in those 120 seconds.

 "The Astronaut's Wife," written and directed by Rand Ravich, poorly executes good ideas. We have imaginative and potentially suspenseful ideas with this film's concepts behind such happenings in two minutes as Spencer and Alex are in galactic boundaries. The gradual increase in Spencer's unusual behavior depicts effective suspense-but thorough introduction of the characters does not take place, nor do we witness the key events in which the rest of the move hinges upon. Consequently, "The Astronaut's Wife" does not work.

The film's first act is full of incidences, characters, and subplots. Clearly too many things happen too early in the story. Within the first thirty minutes the production attempts to develop two separate relationships, shows us the atmosphere of a teacher's workplace, something bizarre transpires out of earth's orbit, a decision is made to resign and move to New York, a suicide takes place, a character mysteriously dies, and probably more. I just couldn't follow the plot.

I liked the eerie, supernatural overtones located throughout the production. The film is smart to reveal the right amounts of information at the precise time. There is also a certain style to "The Astronaut's Wife," containing an elusive mood, a weirdly intriguing design, and some tense and unusual camera angles. The movie becomes more interesting as we reach the closing.

Charlize Theron has been in a lot of movies lately, but "The Astronaut's Wife" is her first leading role. She seems to have come out of left field in 1997 with the comedy "Trail and Error." Afterwards, she contributed larger performances in "The Devil's Advocate," "Celebrity," "Mighty Joe Young," and most recently "The Cider House Rules," and "Reindeer Games." Her role in "The Astronaut's Wife" is a little more complex than her past credits, excluding her enticing and believable acting job in "The Devil's Advocate." She presents the traumatized Jillian Armacost with the perfect blend of zest and tragic confusion. 

Depp and Theron conjure a chemistry-rich couple. The movie very clearly takes Jillian's point of view instead of allowing us to know mysteries with Spencer. This stays consistent and focused, but sometimes leaves us pondering about unexplained events. 

"The Astronaut's Wife" builds for an awe-inducing conclusion through revealing and intriguing dialogue and an omnipresent undertone. The film suggests a form of extraterrestrial is behind the deaths of several characters as well as the strange behavior of Spencer, but we learn the truth only in the end. Call "The Astronaut's Wife" an unusual "The X Files" episode featuring a cliffhanger conclusion and a supernatural climax. The movie must have appeared really exciting on script. If only more capable filmmakers would have claimed this production we may have had a real winner. Instead audiences feel disappointment and failure, potential is wasted and originality is underscored","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53650,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

Slightly it's revealed that they're not the same as they were." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0138304/","name":"The Astronaut's Wife","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNGI2NzUtYzgwNy00NmIyLTgwNjMtZGMzYjhlYjY1MThkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000234/","name":"Charlize Theron","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000136/","name":"Johnny Depp","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0608012/","name":"Joe Morton"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712444/","name":"Rand Ravich"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0034487/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712444/","name":"Rand Ravich"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Astronaut's Wife","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2357788953","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjA1NDQxODMtY2QzMi00ODYwLTgxZWMtM2UyMjcwZjlmMDk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjA1NDQxODMtY2QzMi00ODYwLTgxZWMtM2UyMjcwZjlmMDk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema","datePublished":"1999-08-27","description":"After an explosion in space and subsequent two-minute radio-out period, two astronauts return home to their wives. Slightly it's revealed that they're not the same as they were.","keywords":"astronaut,mission,electrocuted in bathtub,sister,pilot","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0138304/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Movie-12","dateCreated":"2000-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Visually enticing and well acted, but poorly executes good ideas. ** out of ****.","reviewBody":"THE ASTRONAUT'S WIFE / (1999) **

Johnny Depp plays a NASA astronaut named Spencer Armacost who, while on a space mission, losses contact with Earth for two minutes. He and his colleague, Alex Streck (Nick Cassavetes), return home to their spouses, Jillian Armacost (Charlize Theron) and Natalie Streck (Donna Murphy). Bizarre episodes begin to occur with Alex, leaving Jillian suspicious of her husband's condition. As her husband's strange behavior increases, Jillian begins to question what really happened in those 120 seconds.

 "The Astronaut's Wife," written and directed by Rand Ravich, poorly executes good ideas. We have imaginative and potentially suspenseful ideas with this film's concepts behind such happenings in two minutes as Spencer and Alex are in galactic boundaries. The gradual increase in Spencer's unusual behavior depicts effective suspense-but thorough introduction of the characters does not take place, nor do we witness the key events in which the rest of the move hinges upon. Consequently, "The Astronaut's Wife" does not work.

The film's first act is full of incidences, characters, and subplots. Clearly too many things happen too early in the story. Within the first thirty minutes the production attempts to develop two separate relationships, shows us the atmosphere of a teacher's workplace, something bizarre transpires out of earth's orbit, a decision is made to resign and move to New York, a suicide takes place, a character mysteriously dies, and probably more. I just couldn't follow the plot.

I liked the eerie, supernatural overtones located throughout the production. The film is smart to reveal the right amounts of information at the precise time. There is also a certain style to "The Astronaut's Wife," containing an elusive mood, a weirdly intriguing design, and some tense and unusual camera angles. The movie becomes more interesting as we reach the closing.

Charlize Theron has been in a lot of movies lately, but "The Astronaut's Wife" is her first leading role. She seems to have come out of left field in 1997 with the comedy "Trail and Error." Afterwards, she contributed larger performances in "The Devil's Advocate," "Celebrity," "Mighty Joe Young," and most recently "The Cider House Rules," and "Reindeer Games." Her role in "The Astronaut's Wife" is a little more complex than her past credits, excluding her enticing and believable acting job in "The Devil's Advocate." She presents the traumatized Jillian Armacost with the perfect blend of zest and tragic confusion. 

Depp and Theron conjure a chemistry-rich couple. The movie very clearly takes Jillian's point of view instead of allowing us to know mysteries with Spencer. This stays consistent and focused, but sometimes leaves us pondering about unexplained events. 

"The Astronaut's Wife" builds for an awe-inducing conclusion through revealing and intriguing dialogue and an omnipresent undertone. The film suggests a form of extraterrestrial is behind the deaths of several characters as well as the strange behavior of Spencer, but we learn the truth only in the end. Call "The Astronaut's Wife" an unusual "The X Files" episode featuring a cliffhanger conclusion and a supernatural climax. The movie must have appeared really exciting on script. If only more capable filmmakers would have claimed this production we may have had a real winner. Instead audiences feel disappointment and failure, potential is wasted and originality is underscored","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53650,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

Being young meant that watching a movie of this grandure in a grand movie theatre with massive screen (something that was dying out at the time) means that this movie has been engraved in my mind . But it is not due to nostalgia or corrupt memory . Contact is a thought provoking mind bending movie ahead of its time . In fact it is the Interstellar of the 90s .

Stunning gorgeous visuals , and a storyline and plot asking some hard questions and providing answers that many might not want to accept as the movie battles between science fitction , science fact and religion in a way that in the end no one is left wanting .

This is not just a movie , this is an event !","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":259418,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

malevolent eight foot robot.","keywords":"female frontal nudity,lust,psychopath,infatuation,woman wears a towel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079285/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"amesmonde"},"dateCreated":"2015-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Flawed with fantastic ideas","reviewBody":"Two lovers stationed on a remote moon base of Saturn are intruded upon by a murderous man and his malevolent 8-ft robot.

Its production issues, changing of directors (one of which was the late great John Barry) and budget cuts aside for a film that was made in 1980 it feels like late 60s/70s. That said, the sets that take a leaf from Alien (1979) are partially effective and the blue ominous lighting works but is sadly used sparingly.

The late Farrah Fawcett is still a major draw and although there's a cringe worthy age gap between leads it is fitting to the narratives themes. Acting legend Kirk Douglas is a little inconsistent and not on form possibly due to the script or production woes. Harvey Keitel has been unconventionally re-dubbed which is a shame, but he still is effective as the homicidal sociopath, off beat, boorish Earth Captain Benson. Although choppy, there's some great setups with the interestingly designed Hector robot and Elmer Bernstein's score if fantastic. 

It's not purposely ambiguous, but it leaves many questions and loose ends. It's by no means the worst science-fiction movie, John Barry's story offers some great ideas and has clearly influenced subsequent scifi's notably the Matrix (1999) plug-in.

It's flawed and inconsistent but still worth viewing for the concept alone."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8663,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

A group of strangers visit an ancient Hungarian castle and bring along a werewolf." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097534/","name":"Howling V: The Rebirth","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRmYzJlMzYtMmNkYS00OTQwLThhMjktYmQyOGYzNDE3YTIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0205289/","name":"Phil Davis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146206/","name":"Victoria Catlin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0796148/","name":"Elizabeth Shé"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0839237/","name":"Neal Sundstrom"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103640/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069757/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014531/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2427173/","name":"Clive Turner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746513/","name":"Freddie Rowe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104707/","name":"Gary Brandner"}],"datePublished":"1990-07-10","description":"A group of strangers visit an ancient Hungarian castle and bring along a werewolf.","keywords":"werewolf,castle,sequel,man wears eyeglasses,year 1489","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097534/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cdusher"},"dateCreated":"2001-05-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not Bad (for a Howling movie)","reviewBody":"Howling V is my favorite so far out of all the Howling movies. However, that doesn't mean this is a good film. The acting is pretty bad and the effects are absolutely horrid, but the plot is decent enough to make it tolerable. This one, the original Howling, and Howling IV are the only ones worth watching out of the first 5 flicks. The Howling series is really really bad. Only true horror fanatics would be interested in them at all. The only worse horror series i have encountered is the Children of the Corn series. Howling V is pretty predictible and the characters aren't killed off fast enough, so it moves kind of slowly. The music played after each death is annoying too. Recommended for Horror/Werewolf fans. Rating 4 of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2407,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

However, that doesn't mean this is a good film. The acting is pretty bad and the effects are absolutely horrid, but the plot is decent enough to make it tolerable. This one, the original Howling, and Howling IV are the only ones worth watching out of the first 5 flicks. The Howling series is really really bad. Only true horror fanatics would be interested in them at all. The only worse horror series i have encountered is the Children of the Corn series. Howling V is pretty predictible and the characters aren't killed off fast enough, so it moves kind of slowly. The music played after each death is annoying too. Recommended for Horror/Werewolf fans. Rating 4 of 10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2407,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4,"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

malevolent eight foot robot.","keywords":"female frontal nudity,lust,psychopath,infatuation,woman wears a towel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079285/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"amesmonde"},"dateCreated":"2015-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Flawed with fantastic ideas","reviewBody":"Two lovers stationed on a remote moon base of Saturn are intruded upon by a murderous man and his malevolent 8-ft robot.

Its production issues, changing of directors (one of which was the late great John Barry) and budget cuts aside for a film that was made in 1980 it feels like late 60s/70s. That said, the sets that take a leaf from Alien (1979) are partially effective and the blue ominous lighting works but is sadly used sparingly.

The late Farrah Fawcett is still a major draw and although there's a cringe worthy age gap between leads it is fitting to the narratives themes. Acting legend Kirk Douglas is a little inconsistent and not on form possibly due to the script or production woes. Harvey Keitel has been unconventionally re-dubbed which is a shame, but he still is effective as the homicidal sociopath, off beat, boorish Earth Captain Benson. Although choppy, there's some great setups with the interestingly designed Hector robot and Elmer Bernstein's score if fantastic. 

It's not purposely ambiguous, but it leaves many questions and loose ends. It's by no means the worst science-fiction movie, John Barry's story offers some great ideas and has clearly influenced subsequent scifi's notably the Matrix (1999) plug-in.

It's flawed and inconsistent but still worth viewing for the concept alone."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8663,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Crimson Peak
Crimson Peak
programme.desc: Crimson Peak: Directed by Guillermo del Toro. With Mia Wasikowska, Jessica Chastain, Tom Hiddleston, Charlie Hunnam. In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, she is swept away to a house that breathes, bleeds - and remembers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2554274/","name":"Crimson Peak","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmNkYzk3YjItOTMwYy00ZWViLWIxMTUtZDJiZmY0ZWExYjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1985859/","name":"Mia Wasikowska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1567113/","name":"Jessica Chastain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1089991/","name":"Tom Hiddleston"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0839619/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0730422/","name":"Matthew Robbins"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi924626969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU1OTQ4ODgxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjUwNTAwNjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU1OTQ4ODgxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjUwNTAwNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, she is swept away to a house that breathes, bleeds...and remembers."},"datePublished":"2015-10-16","description":"In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, she is swept away to a house that breathes, ","keywords":"incest,ghost,gothic,loss of mother,haunted mansion","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2554274/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jerghal"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A great film and welcome break from the jump scare flicks","reviewBody":"I was getting pretty sick of those jump-scare-there's-something-lurking-in-a-dark-corner style movies like Insidious and the Conjuring. And Guillermo Del Toro must have thought the same thing because Crimson Peak is a gorgeous looking Gothic style movie with awesomely designed sets which have an incredible amount of detail to them. This adds a great dark and brooding atmosphere to the film and alleviates the need for these aforementioned jump scares. The story is well written and has great characters played by Mia Wasikowska, Tom Hiddleston and other well cast actors. Unfortunately it got only moderate critical reviews and was also somewhat ignored by the audience in favor of Goosebumps no less. Damn kids, they ruin everything! wink emoticon\n\nBut it might get a second life in the video circuit as people might still discover this very enjoyable movie. Big thumbs up for me!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134687,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: I dalje radimo non stop
programme.desc: David Jason ponovo je trgovac Grenvile, koji je nasledio mali dućan od voljenog, ali škrtog ujaka Arkvrajta. Grenvile sada vodi dućan zajedno sa svojim veselim i zgodnim sinom Lirojem, koji se rodio... David Jason ponovo je trgovac Grenvile, koji je nasledio mali dućan od voljenog, ali škrtog ujaka Arkvrajta. Grenvile sada vodi dućan zajedno sa svojim veselim i zgodnim sinom Lirojem, koji se rodio iz kratkog ljubavnog susreta od pre dvadesetak godina. Grenvile je i dalje na usluzi zajednici na svoj neponovljivi način. Željan zarade, Grenvile smišlja razne nepromišljene planove za podsticanje kupaca da ostave što više novca, ali retko kad postiže očekivane rezultate. Liroju ne nedostaje ženske pažnje, a Grenvilovo udvaranje staroj ljubavi Mavis stalno ometa njena žestoko zaštitnička sestra Madž. Tu je i uvek prisutna Crna Udovica, koja je takođe bacila oko na Grenvila, čini se.

programme.title: Škorpija
programme.desc: Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine:... Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine: Tobi Kurtis (Eddie Kaye Thomas), fini bihevioralista; Hapi Kin (Jadyn Wong) vunderkind za mehaniku i Silvester Dod (Ari Stidham), odličan statističar. Iako se međusobno odlično razumiju, vanjski svijet je za njih zagonetka. Srećom, Pejdž Dinin (Katharine McPhee) ima mladog sina koji će ih "prevesti" u vanjski svijet. Svi pobjeđuju s ovim timom: svojom izuzetnom domišljatošću rješavaju nacionalne krize, pomažući sebi da se uklope u stvarni svijet.

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Emmit Stussy, "kralj parkirališta Minnesote", zgodan je, samoostvareni mogul nekretnina sa savršenom porodicom, prava američka priča o uspjehu. Emmit Stussy, "kralj parkirališta Minnesote", zgodan je, samoostvareni mogul nekretnina sa savršenom porodicom, prava američka priča o uspjehu. Ray je više upozoravajuća priča. Umoran od života u Emmitovoj sjeni, Ray je proćelav, debeljuškast socijalni radnik koji je silno ogorčen kartama koje su mu podijeljene, a za to okrivljuje brata. Njihovo bratsko suparništvo vodi ih na krivi put koji počinje sitnim krađama, ali ubrzo dovodi do ubistava, mafijaša i surovog natjecateljskog bridža. Sitno suparništvo između dvojice braće eskalira i donosi haos maloj minesotskoj zajednici.

programme.title: Sajnfeld
programme.desc: Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet... Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet Emija, tri Zlatna globusa i pregršt drugih nagrada, čiji je broj mali u odnosu na višemilionski auditorijum koji je svake nedelje sedeo pred televizijskih ekrana kako bi video šta to njemu večeras na tako smešan i komičan način, smeta. Džeri je komičar koji ima najboljeg prijatelja, bivšu devojku koja mu postaje najbolja prijateljica i komšiju koji mu postaje deo života. Itekako mu ide sa ženama, ali nijedna mu ne odgovara: ili ima veliki nos, ili je prelepa, ali ne baš pod svakim svetlom itd...ali vremenom mu sve to postaje dosadno i odluči da menja svoj život.

credits.actor: Denis Leary, Michael Lombardi, Steven Pasquale, Andrea Roth, John Scurti, Daniel Sunjata, Callie Thorne, Natalie Distler

programme.title: Opasna igra
programme.desc: Radnja serije prati brilijantnu ali istovrmeno nemilosrdnu advokaticu Peti Hjuz, njenu štićenicu Elen Parsons i advokatsku kancelariju Hjuz u Njujorku. Upoznajte mladu, inteligentnu, ambicioznu i diplomiranu pravnicu, Elen Parsons (Rouz Birne) koja je postala štićenica Patricije Hivs (Glen Klouz), nemilosrdne advokatice s dugogodišnjim iskustvom, kojoj baš ništa ne predstavlja prepreku do dobijanja parnice. Peti je osoba kojoj ne sme ništa stati na put, jer ona će manipulacijom i dobrom, ali i opasnom strategijom doći do svog cilja.

programme.title: Monk Mali Pas
programme.desc: Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli. Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli.

credits.actor: Bob Odenkirk, Rhea Seehorn, Jonathan Banks, Michael McKean, Patrick Fabian, Michael Mando, Julie Ann Emery, Jeremy Shamos

Eve je bila zaljubljena u dječaka po imenu Adam, ali se ta... Biti Eve je serija fokusirana na tinejdžerku, Evu Baxter i njene dnevne probleme. Njeni su roditelji razvedeni, ali žive jedno do drugog. Eve je bila zaljubljena u dječaka po imenu Adam, ali se ta veza raspala. Ona završava sa jednim dečkom po imenu Sam Hooper, sa kojim se prvi put poljubila, još dok su bili djeca.

programme.desc: Biti Eve je serija fokusirana na tinejdžerku, Evu Baxter i njene dnevne probleme. Njeni su roditelji razvedeni, ali žive jedno do drugog. Eve je bila zaljubljena u dječaka po imenu Adam, ali se ta... Biti Eve je serija fokusirana na tinejdžerku, Evu Baxter i njene dnevne probleme. Njeni su roditelji razvedeni, ali žive jedno do drugog. Eve je bila zaljubljena u dječaka po imenu Adam, ali se ta veza raspala. Ona završava sa jednim dečkom po imenu Sam Hooper, sa kojim se prvi put poljubila, još dok su bili djeca.

programme.title: Monk Mali Pas
programme.desc: Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli. Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli.

credits.actor: Bob Odenkirk, Rhea Seehorn, Jonathan Banks, Michael McKean, Patrick Fabian, Michael Mando, Julie Ann Emery, Jeremy Shamos

programme.title: Škola Crna rupa
programme.desc: Pet učenika i njihov nastavnik istražuju paranormalne pojave koje se dešavu u njihovoj školi. Pet učenika i njihov nastavnik istražuju paranormalne pojave koje se dešavu u njihovoj školi.

programme.title: Škorpija
programme.desc: Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine:... Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine: Tobi Kurtis (Eddie Kaye Thomas), fini bihevioralista; Hapi Kin (Jadyn Wong) vunderkind za mehaniku i Silvester Dod (Ari Stidham), odličan statističar. Iako se međusobno odlično razumiju, vanjski svijet je za njih zagonetka. Srećom, Pejdž Dinin (Katharine McPhee) ima mladog sina koji će ih "prevesti" u vanjski svijet. Svi pobjeđuju s ovim timom: svojom izuzetnom domišljatošću rješavaju nacionalne krize, pomažući sebi da se uklope u stvarni svijet.

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Emmit Stussy, "kralj parkirališta Minnesote", zgodan je, samoostvareni mogul nekretnina sa savršenom porodicom, prava američka priča o uspjehu. Emmit Stussy, "kralj parkirališta Minnesote", zgodan je, samoostvareni mogul nekretnina sa savršenom porodicom, prava američka priča o uspjehu. Ray je više upozoravajuća priča. Umoran od života u Emmitovoj sjeni, Ray je proćelav, debeljuškast socijalni radnik koji je silno ogorčen kartama koje su mu podijeljene, a za to okrivljuje brata. Njihovo bratsko suparništvo vodi ih na krivi put koji počinje sitnim krađama, ali ubrzo dovodi do ubistava, mafijaša i surovog natjecateljskog bridža. Sitno suparništvo između dvojice braće eskalira i donosi haos maloj minesotskoj zajednici.

programme.title: Sajnfeld
programme.desc: Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet... Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet Emija, tri Zlatna globusa i pregršt drugih nagrada, čiji je broj mali u odnosu na višemilionski auditorijum koji je svake nedelje sedeo pred televizijskih ekrana kako bi video šta to njemu večeras na tako smešan i komičan način, smeta. Džeri je komičar koji ima najboljeg prijatelja, bivšu devojku koja mu postaje najbolja prijateljica i komšiju koji mu postaje deo života. Itekako mu ide sa ženama, ali nijedna mu ne odgovara: ili ima veliki nos, ili je prelepa, ali ne baš pod svakim svetlom itd...ali vremenom mu sve to postaje dosadno i odluči da menja svoj život.

credits.actor: Denis Leary, Michael Lombardi, Steven Pasquale, Andrea Roth, John Scurti, Daniel Sunjata, Callie Thorne, Natalie Distler

programme.title: Opasna igra
programme.desc: Radnja serije prati brilijantnu ali istovrmeno nemilosrdnu advokaticu Peti Hjuz, njenu štićenicu Elen Parsons i advokatsku kancelariju Hjuz u Njujorku. Upoznajte mladu, inteligentnu, ambicioznu i diplomiranu pravnicu, Elen Parsons (Rouz Birne) koja je postala štićenica Patricije Hivs (Glen Klouz), nemilosrdne advokatice s dugogodišnjim iskustvom, kojoj baš ništa ne predstavlja prepreku do dobijanja parnice. Peti je osoba kojoj ne sme ništa stati na put, jer ona će manipulacijom i dobrom, ali i opasnom strategijom doći do svog cilja.
